title: Add proposal for local-cluster tool
body:
The proposal is mostly based on the current version of
[kubeadm-dind-cluster](https://github.com/Mirantis/kubeadm-dind-cluster).

The idea was previously discussed on sig-cluster-lifecycle (meetings, slack channel & during KubeCon).

The name of the tool can be changed if necessary if it's considered too confusing (`local-cluster` can replace `hack/local-up-cluster.sh` for many use cases but it's quite different)

title: Update design doc with 1.8 features/changes
body:
**What this PR does / why we need it:**
Update design doc with 1.8 features/changes

**Special notes for your reviewer:**
Still in progress, but shared to start gathering feedbacks/contributions
Below task for this PR; please let me know if something is missing:

kubeadm first level to be documented / reviewed for 1.8 
- [x] init > in progress; see details below
- [x] join > to do; see details below 
- [x] Upgrade > not needed in this document, not at least initially. Upgrades will have its own doc
- [x] Config > quoted when talking about the upload config phase
- [x] Token > quoted when talking about token/csr
- [x] Alpha > quoted when talking about phases
- [x] Reset > scaffoholding/not relevant for design doc
- [x] Version > scaffoholding/not relevant for design doc
- [x] Completion > scaffoholding/not relevant for design doc

kubeadm init phases to be documented / reviewed for 1.8
- [x] PreFlight
- [x] cert
- [x] kubeconfig
- [x] controlplanephase
- [x] etcd
- [x] wait
- [x] UploadConfiguration
- [x] MarkMaster
- [x] BootstrapTokens  
- [x] Addons
- [x] Self hosting

kubeadm join phases to be documented / reviewed for 1.8
- [x] Discovery
- [x] TLS Bootstrap 

Others topics to be documented / reviewed for 1.8 ...
- [x] UsingExternalCA
- [x] dry-run
- [x] feature-gates

title: Add script for testing pinned releases
body:
Fixes #264. Based on @krzyzacy's feedback, we should create a basic bash script that verifies there are matching kubeadm debs for kubernetes releases.

The next steps after this are:

1. add new prow jobs to test-infra that run this script from this repo
2. add other linux distros (using `yum list` or something)

Running this on ubuntu, this is the output:

```
Skipped these versions:
 v1.5.8
These versions do not have matching debs:
 v1.6.12 v1.7.9 v1.6.10 v1.6.9 v1.6.8
```

Should we have debs for those releases? 

/cc @luxas @timothysc @krzyzacy

title: Merge vagrant-kubeadm-testing for contributor experience
body:
We discussed on last week's kubeadm call, that we would like move this
repo into the kubeadm contributor repo, so we improve our shared tooling
and contributor experience.

This vagrant environment has been shown to aide in developer ramp up for
new contributors.
The documentation fixes provide a happier path to discovering how to
build the software.

approved by @timothysc

Fixes: https://github.com/stealthybox/vagrant-kubeadm-testing/issues/1

title: Add certified-k8s logo for 1.10 and fix broken link for 1.9
body: Fixes: #767

title: kubeadm-contrib-ux
body:
As discussed in Cophenanghen, the contrib experience for kubeadm should be improved, supporting a consistent approach to manual testing during each release cycle.

This PR extends the first version of the kubeadm vagrant test environment from @stealthybox by adding the capability to create a set of vagrant machines starting from a cluster API spec.

IMPORTANT! This PR focuses only on the final user experience and it is meant to get feedbacks on the proposed solution; all the necessary hack/ansible scripts will follow in a subsequent PRs

/CC @timothysc @luxas @stealthybox @liztio @detiber @chuckha

title: kubeadm-contrib-hack-lib
body:
This PR implements the second part of https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/pull/795 (2 of 3), that consists of a set of scripts that are responsible for parsing the cluster API spec and translates it into something that can be used by Vagrant and by the ansible provisioner.

NB. the test guide is only drafted, and it is intended to be improved over time ;-)

/CC @timothysc @luxas @stealthybox @liztio @detiber @chuckha

title: Update the packages publication verification script
body:
This PR:
 - Adds documentation
 - Doesn't hard-code the supported kubernetes versions so the script actually can work without maintenance (which effectively removes the usefulness of the e2e test)
 - Adds support for rpms in the same script
 - Improves the readability of the output
 - Fixes https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/issues/799

cc @jamiehannaford @ixdy @timothysc

title: add an e2e test for verifying manifest lists
body:
this PR adds an e2e test for verifying the manifests lists.
on top of `verify_manifest_lists.go` there are some details on how this works.

QUESTION: this basically traverses manifest lists json files until it reaches the image layers.
currently download of the layers is skipped and only the `Content-Length` of their headers is verified.
these can end up being quite large, so should the full download of all layers be enabled? (the toggle is called `downloadLayers`).

test-infra PR to follow.

/hold
/assign @timothysc 
/cc @dims @BenTheElder @ixdy @Random-Liu

title: WIP: enable terraform as deploy-tool on libvirt-kvm

This pr is a proposal to use in addition to vagrant the terraform-libvirt provider which i'm co-maintainting  on https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt.

I proposing it as wip for gathering some ideas and interest first before i do the project.

I wil follow the same structure as `vagrant` and tooling etc.

We could do it similar to https://github.com/MalloZup/ceph-open-terrarium/tree/master/examples/libvirt with all distro supported in longterm.

title: Local environment setup improvement
body:
2 changes here to improve getting set up for kubeadm-playground development.

1. Added a stock `Pipfile` with the required `pyyaml` package and Python version to make local development less fraught with missing dependencies.

2. Updated the alias for `kubeadm-playground` to make sure it allows `pipenv` to pick up on the correct path to the `Pipfile`.
